articles.headline: Madoff Will Plead Guilty; Faces Life for Vast Swindle
articles.snippet: Facing life in prison for operating a vast Ponzi scheme, Bernard L. Madoff is expected to plead guilty on Thursday.
articles.abstract: Facing life in prison for operating a vast Ponzi scheme, Bernard L. Madoff is expected to plead guilty on Thursday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bernard L. Madoff is facing life in prison for operating a vast Ponzi scheme that began at least 20 years ago and consumed billions of dollars of other people’s money.

articles.headline: As Jobs Vanish, Motel Rooms Become Home
articles.snippet: Many victims of the recession are living in garages or in motels, uncounted and often receiving little public aid.
articles.abstract: Many victims of the recession are living in garages or in motels, uncounted and often receiving little public aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: COSTA MESA, Calif.  Greg Hayworth, 44, made a good living in his home state, California, from real estate and mortgage finance. Then that business crashed, and early last year the bank foreclosed on the house his family was renting, forcing their eviction.

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Plans to Market Digital Health Records System
articles.snippet: The company said its package deal of hardware, software, installation and service will make the technology more affordable for small physician offices.
articles.abstract: The company said its package deal of hardware, software, installation and service will make the technology more affordable for small physician offices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores is striding into the market for electronic health records, seeking to bring the technology into the mainstream for physicians in small offices, where most of America’s doctors practice medicine.

articles.headline: Europeans Debate Castration of Sex Offenders
articles.snippet: Whether castration can help rehabilitate violent sex offenders is under scrutiny in the Czech Republic.
articles.abstract: Whether castration can help rehabilitate violent sex offenders is under scrutiny in the Czech Republic.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE  Pavel remembers the violent night sweats two days before the murder. He went to see a family doctor, who said they would go away. But after viewing a Bruce Lee martial arts film, he said, he felt uncontrollable sexual desires. He invited a 12-year-old neighbor home. Then he stabbed the boy repeatedly.

articles.headline: Those Who Lost Savings Find Little Comfort
articles.snippet: News that Mr. Madoff was not seeking a lighter sentence provided relief, but many victims are still left with many questions.
articles.abstract: News that Mr. Madoff was not seeking a lighter sentence provided relief, but many victims are still left with many questions.
articles.lead_paragraph: For those who lost everything to Bernard L. Madoff, news that he plans to plead guilty and face life in prison brings little comfort.

articles.headline: The Looting of America’s Coffers
articles.snippet: An academic paper in the early 1990s had predicted the behavior of the banks when it came to relying on the government to absorb their losses.
articles.abstract: An academic paper in the early 1990s had predicted the behavior of the banks when it came to relying on the government to absorb their losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sixteen years ago, two economists published a research paper with a delightfully simple title: “Looting.”

articles.headline: Advertisers Get a Trove of Clues in Smartphones
articles.snippet: Cellphones have a high potential for personalized ads, and advertisers place great value on the possibility.
articles.abstract: Cellphones have a high potential for personalized ads, and advertisers place great value on the possibility.
articles.lead_paragraph: The millions of people who use their cellphones daily to play games, download applications and browse the Web may not realize that they have an unseen companion: advertisers that can track their interests, their habits and even their location.

articles.headline: Hundreds Jailed as Pakistan Bans Planned Protest
articles.snippet: Police arrested hundreds of activists as the opposition party leader urged supporters to defy a ban on protests.
articles.abstract: Police arrested hundreds of activists as the opposition party leader urged supporters to defy a ban on protests.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The civilian government banned a national protest march and arrested hundreds of political workers on Wednesday, evoking for many Pakistanis the sweeping security restrictions of the military dictator, Gen. Pervez Musharraf.
